member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityNotMappedException
member.summary: Represents an exception for a principal whose identity could not be mapped to a known identity.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified error message and inner exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If is not null, the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.

The object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.summary: Represents the collection of unmapped identities for an exception.

member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified initial size.

member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Translate(System.Type)
member.summary: Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type. Calling this method is the same as calling with the second parameter set to , which means that exceptions will not be thrown for items that fail conversion.
member.param: The type to which items in the collection are being converted.
member.returns: A collection that represents the converted contents of the original collection.

member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Translate(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type and uses the specified fault tolerance to handle or ignore errors associated with a type not having a conversion mapping.
member.param: The type to which items in the collection are being converted.

A Boolean value that determines how conversion errors are handled.
